intro: Mesothema australe, commonly known as the Australian mesothema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Mesothema australe is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
